>@UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.class-features.Item.hIhgdXnqGHBm0A64]{Envoy Improvisation}

@Icon[type:language-dependent] @Icon[type:mind-affecting] @Icon[type:sense-dependent]

As a reaction when an ally within 60 feet of you is reduced to 0 HP and would become unconscious, you can compel them to stay up and stagger out of the fray. The ally remains conscious, becomes @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.conditions.Item.LoRydw1D4bqlbkA2]{nauseated}, and gains temporary Hit Points equal to [[@classes.envoy.levels+@abilities.cha.mod]]{your envoy level + your Charisma modifier} until the end of their next turn. Afterward, if the ally has 0 Hit Points, they become unconscious and dying as normal, including losing 1 Resolve Point at the end of their turn. Once a creature has been affected by this improvisation, theyâ€™re immune to it for 24 hours.

At 6th level, the ally becomes @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.conditions.Item.aAQ6SW6iK0EVq8Ce]{staggered} and @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.conditions.Item.yUtkoIshf4dPruNd]{off-target} rather than nauseated. If the ally is stable and unconscious and spends 1 Resolve Point to regain 1 HP within 1 minute of falling unconscious, they instead regain HP equal to [[@classes.envoy.levels+@abilities.cha.mod]]{your envoy level + your Charisma modifier}.
